title: Giants notes: Cowboys' Hardy sour after loss
text:
Giants notes: Cowboys' Hardy sour after loss October 26, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 26, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
Cowboys’ Hardy sour 
Controversial Cowboys defensive end Greg Hardy got into an animated shouting match on the Dallas sideline with at least two teammates – one of which was injured star receiver Dez Bryant. 
Bryant and others were reportedly trying to calm Hardy down after he confronted numerous special teams players following Dwayne Harris’ game-winning kickoff return for a touchdown with 7:14 remaining in Sunday’s 27-20 loss to the Giants. 
In the Dallas locker room after the game, Hardy responded to six questions from reporters with an answer of "No comment. Next question," or some variation. Hardy had his third sack in two games since returning from a four-game suspension for violating the league’s personal conduct policy. 
Giants sit Moore 
The Giants essentially benched third-year defensive end Damontre Moore by making him inactive, capping a rough week for the team sack leader. 
Moore was fined $20,000 for his late hit on Eagles quarterback Sam Bradford last Monday night, a penalty that kept alive a drive and allowed Philadelphia to march down field for a touchdown. 
With starter Robert Ayers returning after a four-game absence due to a hamstring issue, the Giants opted to keep Moore out of uniform. 
Asked if there was any correlation between the events of the past week involving Moore and the team’s decision to sit him, Giants coach Tom Coughlin said: "That’s between me and him." 
On the spot 
This was Myles White’s first NFL start at gunner on the Giants’ punt coverage team and he made the game-sealing play when returner Cole Beasley botched the catch. White secured possession with 1:26 left, allowing the Giants to run out the clock. 
Briefs 
WR Rueben Randle beat Cowboys CB Brandon Carr with a one-handed catch in the third quarter just one season after Odell Beckham Jr. earned national attention with The Catch at Carr’s expense. "That’s pretty bad luck," Randle said. … Rookie DE Owa Odighizuwa suffered a hamstring injury on the opening kickoff of the second half and did not return. 
— Jeff Roberts and Art Stapleton © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
